IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE-V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
Present:- Smt. Aswathy.S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Monday the 27" day of January, 2025./ 7" Magha, 1946
CCG. 256/2020
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Thumba Police
Station in Crime No. 36/2020.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused : 1. Arun, aged 40 years, S/o. Leen Mariya, Thyvilakom
House, Unit No.2, Valiyaveli, Poundkadavu Ward, Attipra
Village.
2. Violet, aged 60 years, D/o. Esther, Thyvilakom House,
Unit No.2, Valiyaveli, Poundkadavu Ward, Attipra Village.
3. Anto Elias, aged 55 years, S/o. Elias, Neerajam House,
Valiyaveli, Poundkadavu Ward, Attipra Village.
(By Advocate Sri. Vettoor.S. Praksah )
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i) and 509 read
with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused numbers 1 to 3 are found not guilty of offences
punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i) and 509 read with
section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are acquitted of
the said offences under section 248(1) Code of Criminal
Procedure, 1973. Their bail bonds stand cancelled and they are
set at liberty.

23.01.2025 24.01.2025 27.01.2025 No delay
This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i) and
509 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- Due to previous enmity towards
CW1, accused persons infurtherance of their common intention with an
intention to assault CW1, on 06.01.2020, at 17.00 hours, at Valiyaveli Junction,
Poundukadavu Ward, Attipra Village, accused Nos.1 and 2 uttered obscene
words against CW1 and accused No.1 threatened to kill her. Further, accused
No.3 uttered disgusting obscenities towards her. Thus the accused Nos. 1 to 3
thereby have committed offenses u/ss. 294(b), 506(i) and 509 read with section
34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed before this court by the Sub Inspector of police Thumba
police station and the case was taken on file as CC 256/2020. Cognizance was

3 of 6
taken for the offences punishable u/ss. 294(b), 506(i) and 509 read with section
34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860. against the accused persons.

4. On appearance of the accused Nos. 1 to 3 they were enlarged on bail on
18.01.2020. Copies of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to them
under section 207 Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing
prosecution and counsel for accused Nos. 1 to 3, charge framed for offences
w/ss. 294(b), 506(i) and 509 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860,
read over and explained to the accused Nos. 1 to 3 to which they pleaded not
guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Exhibit P1 was marked.
As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the learned
Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW7. In the absence of any
incriminating circumstances against the accused Nos.1 to 3 , questioning of the
accused Nos.1 to 3 , under section 313(1)(b) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973
was dispensed with. Accused Nos. 1 to 3 were called upon to adduce
evidence but no defence evidence was adduced from the side of the accused
Nos. 1 to 3

6. Heard both sides and perused records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 06.01.2020, at 17.00 hours, at Valiyaveli Junction,
Poundukadavu Ward, Attipra Village, accused Nos. 1 to 3 in furtherance of

4 of 6
their common intention uttered obscene words against PW1, which is in or
near public place and thereby accused Nos. 1 to 3 committed an offence
punishable u/s. 294(b) read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(2) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 3 in
furtherance of their common intention, accused No.1 threatened to kill
PW1 and thereby accused Nos. 1 to 3 committed an offence punishable w/s.
506(i) read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(3) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 3 in
furtherance of their common intention, accused no.3 insulting PW1’s
modesty through her acts and thereby accused Nos. 1 to 3 committed an
offence punishable U/s.509 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860
?

(4) If the accused Nos. 1 to 3 are found guilty? What is the order as to
sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 to 3 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point nos. 1 to 3 are
considered together. Prosecution case is that accused have committed offences
punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i) and 509 read with section 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860.

9. PW1, Rejani Anil deposed that she had given complaint to the police regarding the alleged
incident of this case. She admitted her signature in the Ext P1 statement . She
deposed that accused persons were not assaulted her and she has no grievance
against the accused persons .

10. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and she
is justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of

5 of 6
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused Nos 1 to 3 and for the
said reason these points are found against the prosecution.
11. Point Nos. 1 to 3_:- Upon the finding in point Nos. 1 to 3, the accused Nos. 1
to 3 are found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i)
and 509 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are
acquitted for the said offences under section 248(1) of Criminal Procedure
Code 1973. Their bail bonds stand cancelled and they are set at liberty.
No material objects are produced in this case.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 27" day of January, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
